image.altText: A man lays against the wall of a car park.

props.synopsis: Welcome to Portland, Oregon, the US city that decriminalised drugs and nearly immediately regretted it.

title.children: This progressive US state pioneered a radical drug policy, then overdose deaths skyrocketed

image.altText: australian mps hold their thumbs up at an event celebrating the inauguration of Taiwan's new president

props.synopsis: Politicians have spoken out against a direct email from the Chinese Consulate-General in Sydney which raised concerns about 11 MPs attending a Taiwanese function.

title.children: MPs push back against 'intimidation' from Chinese consulate-general over attendance at Taiwan celebration

image.altText: Police tape in front of a river and a bridge in the distance / police looking over the edge of a bridge with a river below

props.synopsis: Police hold concerns for the wellbeing of a newborn baby and its mother after a passer-by found "signs of birth" on a riverbank in suburban Sydney.

title.children: Search underway for mother and baby after 'placenta and umbilical cord' found on Sydney riverbank

image.altText: a weather map of australia showing rain coverage for the week commencing may 27 2024

props.synopsis: A north-west cloud band will engulf Australia this week, signalling a rapid transition away from the monotonous high pressure systems which have dominated recent weather charts.

title.children: Majority of Australia set for soaking rains with first north-west cloud band of the year forecast

image.altText: A family photo featuring mum, dad, and five kids, posing in front of a scenic rainforest and body of water.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Daintree Rainforest does not have mains electricity — so many residents are burning hundreds of litres of "dirty" diesel fuel a week just to keep their businesses running.

title.children: Burning hundreds of litres of diesel just to stay open: Welcome to the rainforest without electricity

image.altText: A smiling, older woman with short, dark hair, large earrings and a dark top.

props.synopsis: The longest serving lord mayor in the city's history says there is still more work to be done, but a Labor councillor has slammed her "astonishing" inability to "admit her mistakes".

title.children: Sydney Lord Mayor Clover Moore confirms decision to run for sixth term

image.altText: A blonde woman with shoulder length hair speaking with two other women behind her on either side

props.synopsis: The eSafety Commissioner's fight against X over videos of the Wakeley stabbing just got messier, with two new groups from the other side of the world granted leave to join the case.

title.children: Something very weird just happened in the eSafety vs X case

image.altText: A wide shot of Rafael Nadal waving to the French Open crowd as fans applaud him as he leaves the Roland Garros court.

props.synopsis: As he has done in every match he played, Rafael Nadal refuses to accept that his career is over until it's over, but his legacy as one of the greatest of all time is secure no matter how it ends.

title.children: 'The King is dead, long live the King': Why Rafael Nadal leaves a legacy that will never be touched

image.altText: a close up of a woman charging an EV

props.synopsis: The NSW government announces more than 650 additional EV charging ports will be provided across 16 local government areas over the next 12 months.

title.children: NSW government announces plan to roll out hundreds of public EV charging ports

image.altText: An image of fire and ashes. Next to it Palestinians searching through the ashes with their hands.

props.synopsis: Israel's leader told parliament the strike was not intended to kill civilians and will be investigated.

title.children: Israeli PM admits something 'went tragically wrong' in strike that killed dozens of Palestinians in Rafah

image.altText: A patron a concert holds a shard of glass up to a protester at the front of a concert.

props.synopsis: Tensions flare at a Hobart concert after pro-Palestinian protesters disrupted the performance of Jewish singer-songwriter Deborah Conway, with one audience member smashing a wine glass on the stage and holding the shattered stem towards the face of an activist.

title.children: Deborah Conway concert flares as patron threatens Pro-Palestinian protester with broken wine glass

image.altText: A smiling brown-haired woman puts a 'sold' sticker on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: A surge in home loan hardship requests and a record number of quick resales are two signs that Australia is still perilously close to the edge of the mortgage cliff.

title.children: Behind the smiles and sold stickers, there are early signs of illness in Australia's property market

image.altText: A composite image of Latrell Mitchell's Instagram story and him playing in State of Origin.

props.synopsis: After missing the past two series, Latrell Mitchell says he is available for the NSW Blues but his form has not been good enough for Michael Maguire to pick him for State of Origin I.

title.children: 'I bleed blue': Latrell Mitchell rubbishes reports he didn't want to be picked for Origin

image.altText: Queensland State of Origin captain Daly Cherry-Evans, holding a ball in two hands, posing for a promotional shoot

props.synopsis: Queensland skipper Daly Cherry-Evans says the axing of former NSW captain James Tedesco "sucks" because he has been in the same position and understands the pain.

title.children: Mixed feelings for DCE as great mate Trbojevic replaces Tedesco as NSW captain

image.altText: Close-up of a bomb being carried under a fighter jet taking off.

props.synopsis: Russia's big, cheap, retrofitted Soviet-era bombs have become one of its most effective weapons in its full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Locals who have seen their devastating effects view them as a "super weapon".

title.children: Why Ukraine's hands are tied to stop Russia gaining ground with its new main weapon

image.altText: A man and woman, with their baby in a pram, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's biggest and most successful fashion chains is being hit with sexual harassment allegations. New retail trade figures are also giving further insight into how the Australian economy is performing. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Country Road reponds to sexual harassment allegations, while ASX flatlines with UK and US markets closed

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: One of the weakest retail markets "we've seen in Australia for generations"
Retail turnover weak in April, up only 0.1%
Country Road responds to sexual harassment allegations

image.altText: Andrew Giles during QT

props.synopsis: The federal government's approach to character-based deportation comes under scrutiny after it emerges that several serious offenders, who would have ordinarily been deported under longstanding deportation practices, have instead been allowed to stay.

title.children: Coalition says Labor should not spare convicted offenders from deportation over ties to Australia

image.altText: A black lab sits next to a destroyed cowboy boot she ate.

props.synopsis: The leathery lunch led to the four-year-old canine needing emergency surgery, and while Moose is recovering, the boot will never be the same.

title.children: Moose the labrador ate a cowboy boot. Luckily her owner had the skills to save her

image.altText: A side profile of a man wearing glasses with his hands clasped together and a finger on his mouth.

props.synopsis: Rob Stefanic was involved in appointing Catherine Saunders as his deputy, a position that has a salary of more than $420,000. Follow live.

title.children: Parliament House department head insists he acted appropriately amid reports of relationship with deputy

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Should Australia cut the corporate tax rate?
DPS secretary insists he acted appropriately amid reports of relationship with deputy
Should parliament use AI detection tools?

image.altText: Fire service vehicles parked near stacks of shipping containers at an industrial site.

props.synopsis: Firefighters are still working to contain the blaze that broke out at food manufacturing facility in Bomaderry yesterday.

title.children: Firefighters work to limit explosion risk as grain silo continues to burn in NSW

image.altText: A woman in a black and lime green top, with her hair in tight knots, speaks to a camera as people behind her search in rubble

props.synopsis: The United Nations will hold an emergency meeting to further coordinate the response to the disaster, which has been hampered by the weather and tribal violence in the remote region.

title.children: Woman loses 18 members of her family in PNG landslide as hopes of finding survivors fade

image.altText: A woman standing on an oval smiles. Two women stand near here.

props.synopsis: New courses to help people rejoin the workforce after years of unemployment are teaching skills in fitness, nutrition, money management and self-esteem.

title.children: How does getting fit help you land a job? These women are finding out

image.altText: A man in a blue button-up shirt in a kitchen holding a glass of water and a small white tablet

props.synopsis: A rare condition kept Dan Buss in the shadows his entire life. But thanks to an investigational drug, he can now literally step into the sunlight.

title.children: Drug trial allows man with rare sunlight 'allergy' to take first pain-free steps outside

image.altText: A couple looks at each other and smiles

props.synopsis: In a city that is less affordable than Sydney, London and New York to purchase a home, some young Taiwanese people are trying desperately to buy, while others are giving up on the real estate dream altogether.

title.children: In expensive Taiwan, some young people are giving up on real estate to join the 'moonlight clan' instead

image.altText: Unidentified woman looks away while holding medical records.

props.synopsis: The federal government has been heavily criticised by the domestic, sexual and family violence response sector following its budget. Today its "rapid review" of how to best prevent violence against women will begin in Sydney.

title.children: Expert panel to tell government how to prevent violence against women and children

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses looks right at the camera.

props.synopsis: Justine and her partner cut their losses and sold their home cheap in the inner suburb of Darwin after months of no takers.

title.children: 'There were no takers at all': Seller loses $100,000 putting home on the market in Darwin

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is facing a call to reverse an "interim" law he introduced more than a decade ago to make a Parliament House department exempt from Freedom of Information requests.

title.children: Parliament House department shrouded in secrecy facing calls for greater transparency

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair and a black dress stands in a softly lit Melbourne apartment.

props.synopsis: A building company used to construct affordable housing under a government program has been linked to a notorious residential construction company that collapsed last year amid legal battles.

title.children: Elise thought she had finally found secure housing. Now she's worried her lease is a 'trap'

image.altText: A graphic of a piggy bank with smoking chimneys with dollar notes in the background

props.synopsis: Australia's largest superannuation funds have doubled their investments in high-emitting companies over the past two years, according to environmental finance group Market Forces.

title.children: Which super funds are the biggest investors in fossil fuels? A new report has crunched the numbers

image.altText: Image shows congestion and traffic delays. You can see cars, grey road on a gloomy day.

props.synopsis: Nationally, most of us opt to get behind the wheel when it comes to commuting to work. But as one Australian state slashes public transport fares, experts say there's more to do in improving the way we get around.

title.children: As Queensland trials 50c public transport fares, experts say there are more ways to improve our commute

image.altText: Underwater shot of free diver holding a large flat knife and a net bag full of abalone

props.synopsis: After years of legal battles in their own countries, First Nations activists from around the world are working together to shine a global spotlight on the systemic failure to protect Indigenous fishing rights worldwide.

title.children: First Nations fishers 'scared out of the water' will take fight for traditional rights to United Nations
